Apple___Scab.description: Fungal disease caused by Venturia inaequalis producing dark olive lesions on leaves and fruits.
recommendation: Remove and destroy infected leaves and fruit.
Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or copper hydroxide.
Ensure good air circulation through pruning.

Apple___Black_rot.description: Caused by Botryosphaeria obtusa, forming black circular lesions on leaves, fruit rot, and cankers on branches.
recommendation: Prune out cankers and dispose of mummified fruit.
Spray with captan or thiophanate-methyl fungicides.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: Fungal disease causing bright orange spots on apple leaves and fruits, spread from nearby juniper hosts.
recommendation: Use fungicides like myclobutanil or sulfur early in the season.

Apple___healthy.description: Healthy apple leaves show uniform green color with no lesions or rust spots.
recommendation: Monitor humidity to prevent fungal growth.
Inspect regularly for early disease signs.

Blueberry___healthy.description: Healthy blueberry plants with dark green leaves and no necrotic spots.
recommendation: Apply mulch to conserve soil moisture.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery fungal coating on cherry leaves and fruits caused by Podosphaera clandestina.
recommendation: Apply sulfur-based fungicides early in infection.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.description: Healthy cherry plants with smooth, dark green leaves and no powdery growth.
recommendation: Inspect for early powdery mildew signs.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.description: Fungal disease forming rectangular gray lesions that merge, reducing yield.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: Fungal disease by Puccinia sorghi causing reddish-brown pustules on leaves.
recommendation: Apply fungicide if infection is severe.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Caused by Exserohilum turcicum forming long gray-green lesions on leaves.
recommendation: Use resistant varieties and crop rotation.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.description: Green leaves with no rust pustules or elongated lesions.
recommendation: Maintain crop rotation and balanced nutrients.
Scout fields regularly for leaf diseases.

Grape___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease producing brown lesions on leaves and black shriveled berries.
recommendation: Prune and destroy infected plant parts.
Spray fungicides like myclobutanil or mancozeb.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: Complex fungal disease causing leaf striping and berry shrivel.
recommendation: Remove infected wood and prune during dormancy.
Avoid wounds on vines to prevent fungal entry.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Fungal disease causing brown angular spots leading to leaf drop.

Grape___healthy.description: Healthy grapevine with unblemished green leaves and intact fruit.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: Bacterial disease spread by psyllids, causing yellow shoots, mottled leaves, and bitter fruits.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Caused by Xanthomonas arboricola, leading to leaf and fruit lesions.

Peach___healthy.description: Healthy peach leaves are green with no lesions or chlorosis.
recommendation: Ensure good air circulation by pruning.
Regularly monitor for bacterial or fungal symptoms.
Apply balanced fertilizer during fruiting season.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial disease causing small brown leaf spots and fruit lesions.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.description: Healthy bell pepper plants show lush green foliage and firm fruits.
recommendation: Water at soil level to keep foliage dry.
Inspect regularly for bacterial or fungal issues.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Fungal disease by Alternaria solani causing target-shaped dark spots on older leaves.
recommendation: Ensure proper plant spacing and airflow.

Potato___Late_blight.description: Caused by Phytophthora infestans, leading to water-soaked lesions and rapid plant death.
recommendation: Apply fungicides containing metalaxyl or cymoxanil.

Potato___healthy.description: Healthy potato leaves are green with no necrotic spots or curling.
recommendation: Maintain crop rotation and avoid excess nitrogen.
Use preventive fungicide in wet conditions.

Raspberry___healthy.description: Vibrant raspberry leaves with no wilt, spots, or discoloration.
recommendation: Keep soil moist but not waterlogged.
Monitor for rust and cane blight.

Soybean___healthy.description: Healthy soybean plants show uniform green leaves and good nodulation.
recommendation: Maintain crop rotation and balanced nitrogen fixation.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery coating on leaf surfaces caused by Erysiphe cichoracearum.
recommendation: Apply sulfur or potassium bicarbonate sprays.
Water early in the day to reduce humidity.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Fungal infection causing small purple spots merging into scorched brown areas.
recommendation: Apply fungicides containing captan or myclobutanil.

Strawberry___healthy.description: Healthy strawberry plants with bright green leaves and uniform fruit.
recommendation: Water evenly and maintain straw mulch.
Apply preventive fungicides in humid weather.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Caused by Xanthomonas spp., producing small dark leaf spots and cracked fruit.
recommendation: Avoid working with plants when wet.

Tomato___Early_blight.description: Fungal disease forming concentric target spots on lower leaves, caused by Alternaria solani.
recommendation: Spray fungicides like azoxystrobin or chlorothalonil.
Keep foliage dry and avoid water splash.

Tomato___Late_blight.description: Caused by Phytophthora infestans, rapidly destroying foliage and fruit.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Fungal disease forming yellow patches on upper leaf surfaces and gray mold underneath.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Fungal infection causing small circular spots with dark margins on leaves.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Pest infestation causing stippling and webbing on leaves.
recommendation: Use miticides or neem oil sprays.

Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Fungal disease producing circular brown lesions with concentric rings.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: Viral disease transmitted by whiteflies causing curling and yellowing of leaves.
recommendation: Control whiteflies using insecticidal soap or traps.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Viral disease causing mottled leaves and reduced fruit yield.
recommendation: Disinfect tools and hands between handling plants.

Tomato___healthy.description: Healthy tomato plant with green foliage and normal fruit development.
recommendation: Use neem oil spray every two weeks.
Monitor for insect vectors and fungal lesions.
